alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dauphin; Juniata; Northumberland; Perry; Schuylkill; Snyder; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:49AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SCHUYLKILL... NORTHUMBERLAND...NORTHWESTERN DAUPHIN...JUNIATA...SNYDER...SOUTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM EDT... At 849 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mifflinburg to 10 miles west of Selinsgrove to near Lewistown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fremont, Mount Pleasant Mills and Middleburg around 855 AM EDT. Kratzerville, Kreamer and Port Trevorton around 900 AM EDT. Selinsgrove, Hummels Wharf and Mcalisterville around 905 AM EDT. Sunbury, Shamokin Dam and Newport around 910 AM EDT. Rebuck and Klingerstown around 915 AM EDT. Trevorton, Stonington and Leck Kill around 920 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Edgewood, Gratz, Beavertown, Liverpool and Port Royal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Columbia; Dauphin; Juniata; Northumberland; Perry; Schuylkill; Snyder; Union
